solution_line_template: Black printer inks will cost him {num_black_inks} x ${cost_black_ink} = $<<{num_black_inks}*{cost_black_ink}={cost_black_inks}>>{cost_black_inks}.
Red printer inks will cost him {num_red_inks} x ${cost_red_ink} = $<<{num_red_inks}*{cost_red_ink}={cost_red_inks}>>{cost_red_inks}.
And yellow printer inks will cost him {num_yellow_inks} x ${cost_yellow_ink} = $<<{num_yellow_inks}*{cost_yellow_ink}={cost_yellow_inks}>>{cost_yellow_inks}.

The total amount he has to pay for the printer inks is ${cost_black_inks} + ${cost_red_inks} + ${cost_yellow_inks} = $<<{cost_black_inks}+{cost_red_inks}+{cost_yellow_inks}={total_cost_inks}>>{total_cost_inks}
Therefore, Phantom has to ask ${total_cost_inks} - ${money_given} = $<<{total_cost_inks}-{money_given}={money_to_ask}>>{money_to_ask} more from his mom to be able to buy the printer inks.
